dct:description:
'Conducting research into marine environments and the physical geography of seas. Studying interactions between oceans, continents, atmosphere and biosphere. Providing scientific advice on the sustainable use of coastal and ocean resources, and the impact of climate change. Analysing waves, currents, tides, ocean temperatures, salinity and acoustic properties. Includes oceanographic data collection, such as drilling and mapping of sea floor geology, and consultancy services in support of maritime activities.

See also ENVIRONMENT - Oceans governance: for the management and protection of marine environments.

See also SCIENCE - Biological sciences: for marine biology.'@en

See also TRADE - Intellectual property management - Design rights management: for the intellectual property in structures, machinery, industrial plans or complex artworks.

See also TRADE - Intellectual property management - Patent rights management: for the intellectual property in inventions and industrial or scientific processes.

See also TRADE - Intellectual property management - Trademark registration: for the intellectual property in designs or symbols associated with a business entity or product.'@en

skos:definition:

See also TRADE - Intellectual property management - Design rights management: for the intellectual property in structures, machinery, industrial plans or complex artworks.

dct:description: 'Providing trained personnel to assist citizens who have been victims of crime, or in matters of law enforcement. Managing staff and facilities at police stations. Administering internal command, investigation and disciplinary procedures.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Police administration'@en
skos:definition: 'Providing trained personnel to assist citizens who have been victims of crime, or in matters of law enforcement. Managing staff and facilities at police stations. Administering internal command, investigation and disciplinary procedures.'@en

dct:description:
'Establishing standards and developing initiatives to reduce contamination of the air, water and land by emissions and waste. Developing strategies to counteract the effects of pollutants if accidents occur. Raising awareness and supporting community activities to change common practice. Promoting environmentally friendly alternatives.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Waste management: for services to collect and dispose of garbage.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Pollution emission control: for monitoring compliance with environmental standards.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Water resources - Waterway management: for strategies for salinity management and river care programs.

See also SCIENCE - Earth sciences - Atmospheric sciences: for conducting research into the environmental impact of pollution.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Pollutant prevention programs'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Waste control programs'@en|'Smog prevention programs'@en|'Noise pollution'@en|'Oil spill prevention programs'@en
skos:definition:
'Establishing standards and developing initiatives to reduce contamination of the air, water and land by emissions and waste. Developing strategies to counteract the effects of pollutants if accidents occur. Raising awareness and supporting community activities to change common practice. Promoting environmentally friendly alternatives.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Waste management: for services to collect and dispose of garbage.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Pollution emission control: for monitoring compliance with environmental standards.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Water resources - Waterway management: for strategies for salinity management and river care programs.

See also SCIENCE - Earth sciences - Atmospheric sciences: for conducting research into the environmental impact of pollution.'@en

dct:description:
'Monitoring compliance with standards for the discharge of industrial contaminants and waste. Regulating industry practices through waste minimisation strategies and pollutant inventories. Includes assessment, inspections and providing emissions information to the community.

See also ENVIRONMENT - Pollutant prevention programs: for setting standards and developing initiatives to reduce pollution.

See also SCIENCE - Earth sciences - Atmospheric sciences: for conducting research into the environmental impact of pollution.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Pollution emission control'@en
skos:definition:
'Monitoring compliance with standards for the discharge of industrial contaminants and waste. Regulating industry practices through waste minimisation strategies and pollutant inventories. Includes assessment, inspections and providing emissions information to the community.

See also ENVIRONMENT - Pollutant prevention programs: for setting standards and developing initiatives to reduce pollution.

See also SCIENCE - Earth sciences - Atmospheric sciences: for conducting research into the environmental impact of pollution.'@en

dct:description:
'Conducting clinical investigations of the health of particular groups of individuals. Evaluating the incidence of particular diseases within a geographical area or demographic category. Making recommendations to support public health policy development.

See also STATISTICAL SERVICES- Statistical collection: for collecting statistics and analysing this collected data to identify trends.

See also SCIENCE - Medical and health sciences: for experimental research into human health and disease.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Population-based research'@en
skos:definition:
'Conducting clinical investigations of the health of particular groups of individuals. Evaluating the incidence of particular diseases within a geographical area or demographic category. Making recommendations to support public health policy development.

See also STATISTICAL SERVICES- Statistical collection: for collecting statistics and analysing this collected data to identify trends.

See also SCIENCE - Medical and health sciences: for experimental research into human health and disease.'@en

dct:description:
'Managing sea-based entry and exit points. Building and maintaining infrastructure to allow ships to load or unload passengers and cargo. Monitoring private terminal operators and regulating port activities to protect against environmental impacts. Assessing the integration of road, rail and air transport infrastructure with maritime services. Includes liaison to promote coordination and consistency among port authorities from different jurisdictions.

See also ENVIRONMENT - Oceans governance: for ecologically sustainable development of marine resources.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Cargo control: for handling and storage of goods on marine vessels.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Harbour management: for managing infrastructure that provides protection for ships.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Harbour management: for shipping movements.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Marina management: for dockage facilities for small craft.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Water resources - Waterway management: for regulating the use of rivers and catchment areas.

See also TRADE - Export regulation: for controlling the international movement of goods.

See also TRADE - Import regulation: for controlling the international movement of goods.

See also TRADE - Import regulation - Tariff regulation: for levies and taxes charged at ports.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Port regulation'@en
skos:definition:
'Managing sea-based entry and exit points. Building and maintaining infrastructure to allow ships to load or unload passengers and cargo. Monitoring private terminal operators and regulating port activities to protect against environmental impacts. Assessing the integration of road, rail and air transport infrastructure with maritime services. Includes liaison to promote coordination and consistency among port authorities from different jurisdictions.

See also ENVIRONMENT - Oceans governance: for ecologically sustainable development of marine resources.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Cargo control: for handling and storage of goods on marine vessels.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Harbour management: for managing infrastructure that provides protection for ships.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Harbour management: for shipping movements.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Marina management: for dockage facilities for small craft.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Water resources - Waterway management: for regulating the use of rivers and catchment areas.

See also TRADE - Export regulation: for controlling the international movement of goods.

See also TRADE - Import regulation: for controlling the international movement of goods.

See also TRADE - Import regulation - Tariff regulation: for levies and taxes charged at ports.'@en

dct:description: 'Developing policy and guidelines to support the collection and delivery of letters, parcels and other mail. Establishing standards for pricing and processing, such as ensuring dangerous goods are intercepted. Designing and issuing postage stamps.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Postal services'@en
skos:definition: 'Developing policy and guidelines to support the collection and delivery of letters, parcels and other mail. Establishing standards for pricing and processing, such as ensuring dangerous goods are intercepted. Designing and issuing postage stamps.'@en

dct:description: 'Administering guidelines to assess the professional conduct of health care providers. Evaluating performance against established standards and codes of practice. Investigating complaints and initiating disciplinary proceedings or applying penalties when appropriate. Includes suspending or deregistering practitioners found in breach of regulations.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Practitioner discipline'@en
skos:definition: 'Administering guidelines to assess the professional conduct of health care providers. Evaluating performance against established standards and codes of practice. Investigating complaints and initiating disciplinary proceedings or applying penalties when appropriate. Includes suspending or deregistering practitioners found in breach of regulations.'@en

dct:description:
'Evaluating the qualifications of health care providers to determine their fitness for medical practice. Assessing applications and providing advice to unsuccessful applicants. Maintaining a register of approved applicants who may legally practice.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Overseas skills recognition: for endorsing qualifications obtained outside Australia.

See also HEALTH CARE - Health protocol administration - Practitioner discipline: for suspending or deregistering health care providers.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Practitioner registration'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Health accreditation'@en|'Doctor registration'@en|'General practitioner registration'@en|'Health practitioner registration'@en
skos:definition:
'Evaluating the qualifications of health care providers to determine their fitness for medical practice. Assessing applications and providing advice to unsuccessful applicants. Maintaining a register of approved applicants who may legally practice.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Overseas skills recognition: for endorsing qualifications obtained outside Australia.

See also HEALTH CARE - Health protocol administration - Practitioner discipline: for suspending or deregistering health care providers.'@en

dct:description: 'Drafting statutory rules to support the implementation of laws and parliamentary acts. Analysing government policy and existing legislation. Managing submission and approval processes, printing and gazetting.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Preparation of legislative regulations'@en
skos:definition: 'Drafting statutory rules to support the implementation of laws and parliamentary acts. Analysing government policy and existing legislation. Managing submission and approval processes, printing and gazetting.'@en

dct:description:
'Organising and conducting ceremonies to confer Australian citizenship. Preparing participants to take their citizenship pledge and arranging the presentation of certificates. Coordinating security, publicity and facilities. Includes affirmation ceremonies for existing Australian citizens.

See also GOVERNANCE - Civic celebrations: for other community events and ceremonies to mark significant occasions.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Presentation arrangements'@en
skos:definition:
'Organising and conducting ceremonies to confer Australian citizenship. Preparing participants to take their citizenship pledge and arranging the presentation of certificates. Coordinating security, publicity and facilities. Includes affirmation ceremonies for existing Australian citizens.

See also GOVERNANCE - Civic celebrations: for other community events and ceremonies to mark significant occasions.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing strategies to protect and conserve material in cultural collections. Applying treatments to prevent decomposition over time or through excessive handling. Includes repair of badly damaged items or transfer to stable media. 

See also CULTURAL AFFAIRS - Collection management - Collection storage: for environmental controls that protect cultural materials.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Preservation services'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing strategies to protect and conserve material in cultural collections. Applying treatments to prevent decomposition over time or through excessive handling. Includes repair of badly damaged items or transfer to stable media. 

See also CULTURAL AFFAIRS - Collection management - Collection storage: for environmental controls that protect cultural materials.'@en

dct:description:
'Monitoring and regulating the charges for goods or services offered for sale. Evaluating proposed price increases, where an industry or organisation is under surveillance. Making recommendations on pricing practices.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Monetary policy - Inflation: for monitoring amounts of currency in circulation and the effect on prices.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Prices surveillance'@en
skos:definition:
'Monitoring and regulating the charges for goods or services offered for sale. Evaluating proposed price increases, where an industry or organisation is under surveillance. Making recommendations on pricing practices.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Monetary policy - Inflation: for monitoring amounts of currency in circulation and the effect on prices.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs that deliver essential health care services at the most local level. Ensuring all members of the community have access to basic methods of prevention and treatment for disease or injury. Monitoring the provision of primary health care services in remote or isolated areas.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Community education - Adult education programs: for community-based health education programs.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - School education: for health education of school-aged children.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services - Clinical health services: for programs operating out of medical centres.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services - Health promotion: for basic advice and information to support good health.

See also INDIGENOUS AFFAIRS - Indigenous health services: for developing programs for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Primary health care'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Immunisation programs'@en|'Community health centres'@en|'Maternal health services'@en|'Vaccination programs'@en|'Community midwifery'@en|'Remote community health care'@en|'Family planning'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs that deliver essential health care services at the most local level. Ensuring all members of the community have access to basic methods of prevention and treatment for disease or injury. Monitoring the provision of primary health care services in remote or isolated areas.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Community education - Adult education programs: for community-based health education programs.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - School education: for health education of school-aged children.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services - Clinical health services: for programs operating out of medical centres.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services - Health promotion: for basic advice and information to support good health.

See also INDIGENOUS AFFAIRS - Indigenous health services: for developing programs for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy to support and regulate rural and marine industries. Promoting strategies for efficient and sustainable operations. Administering programs to monitor current practices, to meet national and international standards. Includes liaison with industry bodies and across jurisdictions in relation to the needs of primary industries.

See also BUSINESS SUPPORT AND REGULATION: for supporting and regulating other industries.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES: for supporting and regulating mining industries.

See also SCIENCE: for research to assist primary industries.'@en
rdfs:label: 'PRIMARY INDUSTRIES'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing policy to support and regulate rural and marine industries. Promoting strategies for efficient and sustainable operations. Administering programs to monitor current practices, to meet national and international standards. Includes liaison with industry bodies and across jurisdictions in relation to the needs of primary industries.

See also BUSINESS SUPPORT AND REGULATION: for supporting and regulating other industries.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES: for supporting and regulating mining industries.

See also SCIENCE: for research to assist primary industries.'@en

dct:description:
'Establishing privacy principles to ensure an individual\'s rights to the confidentiality of their personal information. Monitoring compliance with legislation and guidelines. Includes investigating breaches of privacy and evaluating new technology for potential risks to individual privacy.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Administrative law - Freedom of information: providing a right of access to  government  documents.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Administrative law - Recordkeeping standards: for regulating the management of government information in accordance with legislative requirements.

See also SECURITY - Information security: for policy and technology to control data access.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Privacy '@en
skos:definition:
'Establishing privacy principles to ensure an individual\'s rights to the confidentiality of their personal information. Monitoring compliance with legislation and guidelines. Includes investigating breaches of privacy and evaluating new technology for potential risks to individual privacy.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Administrative law - Freedom of information: providing a right of access to  government  documents.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Administrative law - Recordkeeping standards: for regulating the management of government information in accordance with legislative requirements.

See also SECURITY - Information security: for policy and technology to control data access.'@en

dct:description: 'Managing the registration and validation of wills. Authorising a named executor to administer the estate of a deceased person. Includes procedures to handle contested probate requests.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Probate applications'@en
skos:definition: 'Managing the registration and validation of wills. Authorising a named executor to administer the estate of a deceased person. Includes procedures to handle contested probate requests.'@en

dct:description: 'Administering programs to ensure the quality of products offered for sale. Assessing statements made about the goods - such as origin, conditions of sale, warranties and guarantees. Evaluating product safety, banning goods or issuing product recalls. Imposing penalties as appropriate.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Product safety'@en
skos:definition: 'Administering programs to ensure the quality of products offered for sale. Assessing statements made about the goods - such as origin, conditions of sale, warranties and guarantees. Evaluating product safety, banning goods or issuing product recalls. Imposing penalties as appropriate.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing measures and programs to capture the ability of an economy to harness its physical and human resources to generate output and income.
See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT- Financial system management: for policy to maintain stability in the financial system.
See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT- Fiscal policy: for policy for the strategic management and distribution of public money.
See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Monetary policy:  for policy to maintain stability of the currency.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Productivity'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing measures and programs to capture the ability of an economy to harness its physical and human resources to generate output and income.
See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT- Financial system management: for policy to maintain stability in the financial system.
See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT- Fiscal policy: for policy for the strategic management and distribution of public money.
See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Monetary policy:  for policy to maintain stability of the currency.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs to certify individuals as meeting official requirements to perform a skilled occupation. Includes processing applications, managing examinations and setting conditions on the right to apply qualifications in certain fields.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Overseas skills recognition: for endorsing qualifications obtained outside Australia.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Professional accreditation'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Competency standards'@en|'Qualified professionals'@en|'Accreditation criteria'@en|'Professional codes of practice'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs to certify individuals as meeting official requirements to perform a skilled occupation. Includes processing applications, managing examinations and setting conditions on the right to apply qualifications in certain fields.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Overseas skills recognition: for endorsing qualifications obtained outside Australia.'@en

dct:description:
'Regulating the international sale and movement out of Australia of restricted goods such as wildlife, heritage artefacts, weaponry, military equipment, nuclear material, chemicals and toxins, electronics, software and technology, currency, illicit drugs. Includes policy development, procedures for inspection and seizure, and liaison with other jurisdictions.

See also CULTURAL AFFAIRS - Collection management - Artefact export regulation: for negotiating the international movement of cultural material.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Prohibited export control'@en
skos:definition:
'Regulating the international sale and movement out of Australia of restricted goods such as wildlife, heritage artefacts, weaponry, military equipment, nuclear material, chemicals and toxins, electronics, software and technology, currency, illicit drugs. Includes policy development, procedures for inspection and seizure, and liaison with other jurisdictions.

See also CULTURAL AFFAIRS - Collection management - Artefact export regulation: for negotiating the international movement of cultural material.'@en

dct:description:
'Regulating the international purchase and movement into Australia of restricted goods such as medicines and illicit drugs, animals and animal-derived products, plants and plant-derived products, weaponry, military equipment, nuclear material, chemicals and toxins, heritage artefacts, motor vehicles, currency. Includes policy development, procedures for inspection and seizure, and liaison with other jurisdictions.

See also CULTURAL AFFAIRS - Collection management - Artefact export regulation: for negotiating the international movement of cultural material.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Quarantine: for activities to protect Australia from exotic plants, animals and diseases.

See also SECURITY - National security - Border protection: for coordinating operations to monitor Australian borders for unauthorised sea or air arrivals. 

See also TRADE - Import regulation - Tariff regulation: for the imposition of duties or taxes on imports.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Prohibited import control'@en
skos:definition:
'Regulating the international purchase and movement into Australia of restricted goods such as medicines and illicit drugs, animals and animal-derived products, plants and plant-derived products, weaponry, military equipment, nuclear material, chemicals and toxins, heritage artefacts, motor vehicles, currency. Includes policy development, procedures for inspection and seizure, and liaison with other jurisdictions.

See also CULTURAL AFFAIRS - Collection management - Artefact export regulation: for negotiating the international movement of cultural material.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Quarantine: for activities to protect Australia from exotic plants, animals and diseases.

See also SECURITY - National security - Border protection: for coordinating operations to monitor Australian borders for unauthorised sea or air arrivals. 

See also TRADE - Import regulation - Tariff regulation: for the imposition of duties or taxes on imports.'@en

dct:description:
'Bringing individuals or organisations to trial for criminal offences. Carrying on of legal proceedings against a party, in the interests of the public.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Legal aid services: for subsidised defence representation.

See also SECURITY - Corrective services: for punishment and rehabilitation programs.

See also SECURITY - Law enforcement: for crime prevention programs.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Prosecution services'@en
skos:definition:
'Bringing individuals or organisations to trial for criminal offences. Carrying on of legal proceedings against a party, in the interests of the public.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Legal aid services: for subsidised defence representation.

See also SECURITY - Corrective services: for punishment and rehabilitation programs.

See also SECURITY - Law enforcement: for crime prevention programs.'@en

dct:description:
'Providing specialist security products and services to shield an individual from threat of attack. Managing physical security programs, designated persons protection, X-ray screening, bomb threat management and protective surveillance. Includes administration of security personnel through staff vetting and clearance procedures.

See also SECURITY - Intelligence - Intelligence support: for investigative surveillance activities.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Protective services'@en
skos:definition:
'Providing specialist security products and services to shield an individual from threat of attack. Managing physical security programs, designated persons protection, X-ray screening, bomb threat management and protective surveillance. Includes administration of security personnel through staff vetting and clearance procedures.

See also SECURITY - Intelligence - Intelligence support: for investigative surveillance activities.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs to implement the policies and programs of the executive and elected representatives. Review the performance of such programs. Developing policy and guidelines to improve public administration.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Administrative law: for the administration of laws relating to the functions of public agencies.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public administration'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs to implement the policies and programs of the executive and elected representatives. Review the performance of such programs. Developing policy and guidelines to improve public administration.

See also JUSTICE ADMINISTRATION - Administrative law: for the administration of laws relating to the functions of public agencies.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs to raise funds to finance government expenditure, in accordance with fiscal policy. Includes the issue and sale of government bonds.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Fiscal policy - Public debt: for redeeming government bonds.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public borrowing'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs to raise funds to finance government expenditure, in accordance with fiscal policy. Includes the issue and sale of government bonds.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Fiscal policy - Public debt: for redeeming government bonds.'@en

dct:description:
'Managing the repayment of public borrowings, including the redemption of government bonds. Minimising associated costs such as interest payments by coordinating payments with tax revenue inflows.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Fiscal policy - Public borrowing: for the issue and sale of government bonds.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public debt'@en
skos:definition:
'Managing the repayment of public borrowings, including the redemption of government bonds. Minimising associated costs such as interest payments by coordinating payments with tax revenue inflows.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Fiscal policy - Public borrowing: for the issue and sale of government bonds.'@en

dct:description:
'Managing the disbursement of public money in accordance with fiscal policy. Monitoring revenue forecasts and projecting the costs of proposed programs or services. Determining the economic impact of government spending.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Resource management - Financial budgeting: for documenting public revenues and expenditure.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public expenditure'@en
skos:definition:
'Managing the disbursement of public money in accordance with fiscal policy. Monitoring revenue forecasts and projecting the costs of proposed programs or services. Determining the economic impact of government spending.

See also FINANCE MANAGEMENT - Resource management - Financial budgeting: for documenting public revenues and expenditure.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering schemes to encourage physical activity across the community. Developing programs to raise awareness of the health benefits of fitness. Providing activities for target groups and supporting clubs and community groups that promote physical fitness.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services - Health promotion: for raising public awareness of other health issues.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Sport and fitness development: for funding for sport and fitness programs.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public fitness promotion'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering schemes to encourage physical activity across the community. Developing programs to raise awareness of the health benefits of fitness. Providing activities for target groups and supporting clubs and community groups that promote physical fitness.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services - Health promotion: for raising public awareness of other health issues.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Sport and fitness development: for funding for sport and fitness programs.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy to protect the physical and mental wellbeing of all people at a broad level. Establishing programs to understand and control the determinants of disease, and reduce public exposure to risks encountered as part of lifestyle or the environment.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services: for programs that offer direct assistance to individuals or groups.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public health services'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing policy to protect the physical and mental wellbeing of all people at a broad level. Establishing programs to understand and control the determinants of disease, and reduce public exposure to risks encountered as part of lifestyle or the environment.

See also HEALTH CARE - Community health services: for programs that offer direct assistance to individuals or groups.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs to supply low cost government-owned accommodation. Providing guidelines to direct the design of public housing. Evaluating the need for public housing and setting construction targets. Allocating appropriate funds to enable ongoing maintenance.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Accommodation services: for making public housing available to those in need.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Crown land administration: for managing the tenure of government property.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public housing'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs to supply low cost government-owned accommodation. Providing guidelines to direct the design of public housing. Evaluating the need for public housing and setting construction targets. Allocating appropriate funds to enable ongoing maintenance.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Accommodation services: for making public housing available to those in need.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Crown land administration: for managing the tenure of government property.'@en

dct:description:
'Building low cost government-owned accommodation. Managing tenders and overseeing construction projects. Negotiating value for money on materials and services to support affordability. Ensuring that public housing construction meets government targets.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Civic management - Architectural services: for professional advice on the design and construction of public buildings.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Civic management - Building regulations and standards: for ensuring housing meets legal requirements.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public housing construction'@en
skos:definition:
'Building low cost government-owned accommodation. Managing tenders and overseeing construction projects. Negotiating value for money on materials and services to support affordability. Ensuring that public housing construction meets government targets.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Civic management - Architectural services: for professional advice on the design and construction of public buildings.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Civic management - Building regulations and standards: for ensuring housing meets legal requirements.'@en

dct:description:
'Planning and drafting low cost government-owned accommodation. Implementing best practice design strategies to incorporate facilities for tenants with special needs. Ensuring that public housing design meets government guidelines.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Civic management - Architectural services: for professional advice on the design and construction of public buildings.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public housing design'@en
skos:definition:
'Planning and drafting low cost government-owned accommodation. Implementing best practice design strategies to incorporate facilities for tenants with special needs. Ensuring that public housing design meets government guidelines.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Civic management - Architectural services: for professional advice on the design and construction of public buildings.'@en

dct:description:
'Assessing eligibility for community accommodation, against established criteria. Allocating public housing to approved applicants. Providing advice to tenants about their rights and obligations, and options to purchase public housing. Includes entitlement review and complaint processes.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Public housing: for the design, construction and maintenance of public housing.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Financial assistance - Income support schemes: for rental assistance.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public housing entitlements'@en
skos:definition:
'Assessing eligibility for community accommodation, against established criteria. Allocating public housing to approved applicants. Providing advice to tenants about their rights and obligations, and options to purchase public housing. Includes entitlement review and complaint processes.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Public housing: for the design, construction and maintenance of public housing.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Financial assistance - Income support schemes: for rental assistance.'@en

dct:description: 'Preserving and repairing low cost government-owned accommodation. Implementing programs of regular maintenance. Reporting on the condition of public housing and recommending upgrades or major renovation when necessary.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public housing maintenance'@en
skos:definition: 'Preserving and repairing low cost government-owned accommodation. Implementing programs of regular maintenance. Reporting on the condition of public housing and recommending upgrades or major renovation when necessary.'@en

dct:description:
'Controlling and maintaining buildings or areas of land set aside for community use. Providing guidelines to direct the use of public land. Allocating appropriate funds to enable ongoing maintenance. Evaluating the need for public land and providing advice for planning purposes.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Crown land administration: for managing the tenure of government property.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Land use planning: for research into future needs for infrastructure and facilities.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public land management'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Street tree management'@en|'Urban land management'@en|'Street light maintenance'@en|'Urban tree management'@en|'Property'@en
skos:definition:
'Controlling and maintaining buildings or areas of land set aside for community use. Providing guidelines to direct the use of public land. Allocating appropriate funds to enable ongoing maintenance. Evaluating the need for public land and providing advice for planning purposes.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Crown land administration: for managing the tenure of government property.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Land use planning: for research into future needs for infrastructure and facilities.'@en

dct:description:
'Implementing the policies of the executive and elected representatives. Providing services to the community in accordance with agreed performance standards.

See also EMPLOYMENT: for conditions of employment.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Public service'@en
skos:definition:
'Implementing the policies of the executive and elected representatives. Providing services to the community in accordance with agreed performance standards.

See also EMPLOYMENT: for conditions of employment.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing and maintaining a system of vehicles such as buses and trains that operates at regular times on fixed routes and are used by the public.

skos:definition: 'Developing policy to support the design, construction, maintenance and operation of any vehicle operating on a railway track - such as locomotives, carriages, rail cars, rail motors, light rail vehicles, trains, trams or wagons. Ensuring rolling stock conform to operational standards. Conducting inspections, testing and licensing. Includes certification of engine drivers, railway engineers and other personnel engaged in the use or maintenance of rolling stock.'@en

dct:description:
'Supporting outback and country communities through targeted services and programs to develop self-reliance. Establishing social networks and activities. Providing funding and support for community-based or volunteer organisations. Includes activities to improve rural access to government services and liaising with local business to support community projects.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Regional development: for infrastructure projects in rural areas.

See also INDIGENOUS AFFAIRS - Indigenous welfare programs: for social support to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Rural partnership programs: for business and industry support services.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Rural community development'@en
skos:definition:
'Supporting outback and country communities through targeted services and programs to develop self-reliance. Establishing social networks and activities. Providing funding and support for community-based or volunteer organisations. Includes activities to improve rural access to government services and liaising with local business to support community projects.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Regional development: for infrastructure projects in rural areas.

See also INDIGENOUS AFFAIRS - Indigenous welfare programs: for social support to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Rural partnership programs: for business and industry support services.'@en

dct:description: 'Developing programs to support shows, exhibitions and conferences to encourage agricultural innovation. Includes financial assistance and advice on planning and marketing strategies.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Rural field day promotion'@en
skos:definition: 'Developing programs to support shows, exhibitions and conferences to encourage agricultural innovation. Includes financial assistance and advice on planning and marketing strategies.'@en

dct:description:
'Initiating cooperative projects to support change in the operation of primary industries and agricultural business ventures. Developing strategies to help rural enterprises and communities adjust to changing commercial conditions, to improve profitability and competitiveness. Providing advice, training and project funding assistance.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Rural community development: for social support services to country districts.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Marine and rural support: for programs to grow and develop specific industries.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Rural partnership programs'@en
skos:definition:
'Initiating cooperative projects to support change in the operation of primary industries and agricultural business ventures. Developing strategies to help rural enterprises and communities adjust to changing commercial conditions, to improve profitability and competitiveness. Providing advice, training and project funding assistance.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Rural community development: for social support services to country districts.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Marine and rural support: for programs to grow and develop specific industries.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy to support and regulate industries that relay radio and television signals via equipment located in space. Managing government-owned satellite equipment. Providing advice on the introduction of new technology and the effects of government policy on the satellite communication industry. Includes liaison with international bodies on shared access to satellite equipment.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Navigation - Navigation systems development: for the use of satellites in plotting courses at sea.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Search and rescue - Search technology development: for the use of satellites in locating individuals, vessels or aircraft that become lost at sea.

See also SCIENCE - Physical sciences - Astronomical sciences: for the use of satellites in space research.

See also SCIENCE - Spatial information research: for the use of satellites in global positioning research.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Satellite communication'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing policy to support and regulate industries that relay radio and television signals via equipment located in space. Managing government-owned satellite equipment. Providing advice on the introduction of new technology and the effects of government policy on the satellite communication industry. Includes liaison with international bodies on shared access to satellite equipment.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Navigation - Navigation systems development: for the use of satellites in plotting courses at sea.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Search and rescue - Search technology development: for the use of satellites in locating individuals, vessels or aircraft that become lost at sea.

See also SCIENCE - Physical sciences - Astronomical sciences: for the use of satellites in space research.

See also SCIENCE - Spatial information research: for the use of satellites in global positioning research.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs that offer instruction to children, to impart knowledge and develop skills. Providing public school education for children in Years 1 to 12. Monitoring and regulating non-government schools. Managing school facilities. Implementing standards and guidelines to support teachers. Includes the provision of scholarships and study grants.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Arts education: for programs to further artistic talent at individual or community level.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Curriculum development: for researching and drafting outline study programs.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Early childhood education: for teaching children under the age of five years.

See also INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS - Overseas aid programs - Overseas student scholarship programs: for access to higher education for students from developing countries or the Pacific region.'@en
rdfs:label: 'School education'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Secondary schools'@en|'State schools'@en|'Health education'@en|'Primary schools'@en|'Sex education'@en|'Private school regulation'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs that offer instruction to children, to impart knowledge and develop skills. Providing public school education for children in Years 1 to 12. Monitoring and regulating non-government schools. Managing school facilities. Implementing standards and guidelines to support teachers. Includes the provision of scholarships and study grants.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Arts education: for programs to further artistic talent at individual or community level.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Curriculum development: for researching and drafting outline study programs.

dct:description:
'Designing services to help children travel to and from school. Developing standards and guidelines to assist bus drivers or children with special needs. Identifying requirements for bus stops, cycle routes, footpaths, crossings and low speed limits. Liaising with government and non-government organisations to implement and regulate school transport services.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Transport network maintenance: for managing school transport services.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Transport access schemes: for programs to make services available to targeted community groups.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Community education - Road safety awareness: for setting low speed limits in school zones.

See also TRANSPORT - Passenger services: for timetables, route maps and ticketing.'@en
rdfs:label: 'School transport regulation'@en
skos:definition:
'Designing services to help children travel to and from school. Developing standards and guidelines to assist bus drivers or children with special needs. Identifying requirements for bus stops, cycle routes, footpaths, crossings and low speed limits. Liaising with government and non-government organisations to implement and regulate school transport services.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Transport network maintenance: for managing school transport services.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Transport access schemes: for programs to make services available to targeted community groups.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Community education - Road safety awareness: for setting low speed limits in school zones.

See also TRANSPORT - Passenger services: for timetables, route maps and ticketing.'@en

dct:description: 'Developing policy and standards to support research and systematic studies. Administering scientific bodies and monitoring industry research and development programs. Providing funding and implementing promotional strategies. Includes research into living things and their environments, natural laws and the application of knowledge to practical problems.'@en
rdfs:label: 'SCIENCE'@en
skos:definition: 'Developing policy and standards to support research and systematic studies. Administering scientific bodies and monitoring industry research and development programs. Providing funding and implementing promotional strategies. Includes research into living things and their environments, natural laws and the application of knowledge to practical problems.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy for the transportation of people by sea. Monitoring compliance with pricing regulations or the provision of appropriate facilities for passenger convenience. Includes services such as timetables, route maps or ticketing.

See also TRANSPORT - Passenger services: for transportation of people by road, rail or air.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Sea passengers'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing policy for the transportation of people by sea. Monitoring compliance with pricing regulations or the provision of appropriate facilities for passenger convenience. Includes services such as timetables, route maps or ticketing.

See also TRANSPORT - Passenger services: for transportation of people by road, rail or air.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy and providing resources to ensure the safety of individuals, vessels or aircraft that become lost at sea. Managing reporting systems. Monitoring compliance with equipment standards and response requirements. Includes support for community-based services and regulating the use of volunteers and coordinating maritime emergency services.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Natural disasters: for emergencies caused by the elements such as floods, earthquakes, and cyclones.

See also DEFENCE - Emergency management: for cross-jurisdictional operations to deal with large-scale emergencies.

See also DEFENCE - Emergency management - Civil community assistance: for defence forces support in search and rescue operations.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Search and rescue'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing policy and providing resources to ensure the safety of individuals, vessels or aircraft that become lost at sea. Managing reporting systems. Monitoring compliance with equipment standards and response requirements. Includes support for community-based services and regulating the use of volunteers and coordinating maritime emergency services.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Natural disasters: for emergencies caused by the elements such as floods, earthquakes, and cyclones.

See also DEFENCE - Emergency management: for cross-jurisdictional operations to deal with large-scale emergencies.

See also DEFENCE - Emergency management - Civil community assistance: for defence forces support in search and rescue operations.'@en

dct:description:
'Conducting research into the application of specialist knowledge and equipment to assist marine rescue operations. Developing communications systems to help locate individuals, vessels or aircraft lost at sea. Providing technical advice on the purchase of search equipment. Includes designing, testing and overseeing the manufacture of new products.

See also COMMUNICATIONS: for industry regulations and standards.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Navigation - Navigation systems development: for investigating the use of technology to plot courses at sea.

See also SCIENCE - Spatial information research: for investigating practical applications for geographical data.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Search technology development'@en
skos:definition:
'Conducting research into the application of specialist knowledge and equipment to assist marine rescue operations. Developing communications systems to help locate individuals, vessels or aircraft lost at sea. Providing technical advice on the purchase of search equipment. Includes designing, testing and overseeing the manufacture of new products.

See also COMMUNICATIONS: for industry regulations and standards.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Navigation - Navigation systems development: for investigating the use of technology to plot courses at sea.

See also SCIENCE - Spatial information research: for investigating practical applications for geographical data.'@en

dct:description:
'Certifying private or commercial marine vessels as fit for use at sea. Assessing applications to ensure compliance with standards and inspection requirements. Providing training and advice on safety requirements.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety - Ship inspection: for assessing the seaworthiness of vessels.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Seaworthiness'@en
skos:definition:
'Certifying private or commercial marine vessels as fit for use at sea. Assessing applications to ensure compliance with standards and inspection requirements. Providing training and advice on safety requirements.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety - Ship inspection: for assessing the seaworthiness of vessels.'@en

dct:description:
'Maintaining the safety of Australia at all levels of society. Developing policy and programs to guard against internal or external threats to peace and stability. Providing funding for law enforcement, community protection and corrective services. Coordinating intelligence gathering and international security activities.

See also DEFENCE: for protection using military resources.'@en
rdfs:label: 'SECURITY'@en
skos:definition:
'Maintaining the safety of Australia at all levels of society. Developing policy and programs to guard against internal or external threats to peace and stability. Providing funding for law enforcement, community protection and corrective services. Coordinating intelligence gathering and international security activities.

See also DEFENCE: for protection using military resources.'@en

dct:description: 'Conducting research into earthquakes. Monitoring and recording seismic surface waves, quarry blasts and mining activities, and data mapping of tectonic plate structures. Providing scientific advice on hazard management. Includes asset vulnerability assessment and emergency simulation and training, to deal with seismic events and their effects.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Seismology'@en
skos:definition: 'Conducting research into earthquakes. Monitoring and recording seismic surface waves, quarry blasts and mining activities, and data mapping of tectonic plate structures. Providing scientific advice on hazard management. Includes asset vulnerability assessment and emergency simulation and training, to deal with seismic events and their effects.'@en

dct:description:
'Transferring commercial and private marine vessels into or out of active service. Includes ship building activities and supply of captain and crew.

See also DEFENCE - Australian Defence Forces - Navy: for commissioning vessels in the Australian Defence Forces.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety - Seaworthiness: for certifying ship safety and construction.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Ship commissioning'@en
skos:definition:
'Transferring commercial and private marine vessels into or out of active service. Includes ship building activities and supply of captain and crew.

See also DEFENCE - Australian Defence Forces - Navy: for commissioning vessels in the Australian Defence Forces.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety - Seaworthiness: for certifying ship safety and construction.'@en

dct:description:
'Monitoring compliance with standards and guidelines for the design, construction and maintenance of private or commercial marine vessels. Conducting inspections of structural integrity, safety equipment or emissions. Examining foreign flagships in Australian ports to monitor compliance with international regulations.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety - Seaworthiness: for certifying ship safety and construction.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Ship inspection'@en
skos:definition:
'Monitoring compliance with standards and guidelines for the design, construction and maintenance of private or commercial marine vessels. Conducting inspections of structural integrity, safety equipment or emissions. Examining foreign flagships in Australian ports to monitor compliance with international regulations.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety - Seaworthiness: for certifying ship safety and construction.'@en

dct:description:
'Regulating the operation of private or commercial marine vessels to improve security and reduce the risk of accidents or emergencies. Developing standards and guidelines for operational practices and crew competencies. Includes cooperation on maritime personnel safety across jurisdictions.

See also DEFENCE - Australian Defence Forces - Navy: for ship personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Sea passengers: for services to travellers on ships.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety: for investigating incidents or accidents.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Ship personnel'@en
skos:definition:
'Regulating the operation of private or commercial marine vessels to improve security and reduce the risk of accidents or emergencies. Developing standards and guidelines for operational practices and crew competencies. Includes cooperation on maritime personnel safety across jurisdictions.

See also DEFENCE - Australian Defence Forces - Navy: for ship personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Sea passengers: for services to travellers on ships.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship safety: for investigating incidents or accidents.'@en

dct:description:
'Regulating the design, construction and maintenance of private or commercial marine vessels. Developing standards and guidelines for safety equipment, seaworthiness, noise or emissions. Investigating the circumstances and causes of marine accidents. Promoting safety awareness across the maritime industry.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship personnel: for regulating the operation of marine vessels.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Ship safety'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Sea safety'@en|'Marine safety'@en|'Shipbuilding standards'@en|'Safety investigation'@en|'Accident investigation'@en|'Boat safety'@en
skos:definition:
'Regulating the design, construction and maintenance of private or commercial marine vessels. Developing standards and guidelines for safety equipment, seaworthiness, noise or emissions. Investigating the circumstances and causes of marine accidents. Promoting safety awareness across the maritime industry.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Ship personnel: for regulating the operation of marine vessels.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs to support commercial cultivation of forests. Assisting industry growth and development. Encouraging businesses to adopt innovative practices, processes and products. Providing advice on growing or harvesting methods and business management to improve competitiveness.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Marine and rural regulation - Forestry industry: for monitoring and regulating timber industries.

See also SCIENCE - Agricultural sciences: for conducting research into timber growing and forestry products.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Silvicultural industry'@en
skos:definition:
'Administering programs to support commercial cultivation of forests. Assisting industry growth and development. Encouraging businesses to adopt innovative practices, processes and products. Providing advice on growing or harvesting methods and business management to improve competitiveness.

See also PRIMARY INDUSTRIES - Marine and rural regulation - Forestry industry: for monitoring and regulating timber industries.

See also SCIENCE - Agricultural sciences: for conducting research into timber growing and forestry products.'@en

dct:description: 'Administering programs to support the interests of commercial enterprises of limited size or capital. Promoting the establishment of small businesses. Providing advice on the impact of government policy on small business. Includes liaison with industry groups and small business representatives.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Small business advocacy'@en
skos:definition: 'Administering programs to support the interests of commercial enterprises of limited size or capital. Promoting the establishment of small businesses. Providing advice on the impact of government policy on small business. Includes liaison with industry groups and small business representatives.'@en

dct:description: 'Administering programs to encourage the growth of commercial enterprises of limited size or capital. Identifying markets or investment opportunities for small business. Developing quality assurance systems and reporting requirements appropriate to the scale of operations. Allocating grants or incentives for new initiatives.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Small business development'@en
skos:definition: 'Administering programs to encourage the growth of commercial enterprises of limited size or capital. Identifying markets or investment opportunities for small business. dct:description: 'Developing policy and programs to assist commercial enterprises of limited size or capital. rdfs:label: 'Small business services'@en

dct:description: 'Providing financial assistance and services for community-based and non-profit organisations that promote friendship and recreation. Raising awareness of local groups though sponsorship, advertising and facilitating links between organisations.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Social club support'@en
skos:definition: 'Providing financial assistance and services for community-based and non-profit organisations that promote friendship and recreation. Raising awareness of local groups though sponsorship, advertising and facilitating links between organisations.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy to support the fair treatment of all people, regardless of gender, race, colour, ethnicity, age, marital or parental status, sexual preference, disability or religious belief. Ensuring that government services are implemented with fairness and sensitivity to community needs. Reviewing services and making recommendations to improve access. Promoting equal opportunity and anti-discrimination principles. Includes liaison with target groups to evaluate the effectiveness of equity programs.

See also EMPLOYMENT - Human resources development - Workplace equity and justice programs: for ensuring equal employment opportunities.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Social justice and equity'@en

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Community engagement: Governments inviting the commmunity to participate in community consultations.'@en

skos:definition: 'Developing research programs to examine Australians\'  attitudes, beliefs, trends, stratifications and rules.'@en

dct:description:
'Managing programs to prevent or repair damage to the ground or earth. Restoring specific areas to their native state or preventing further degradation. Conducting activities to counteract soil erosion or chemical contamination. Includes funding for joint projects with local business or community groups.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Mineral resources - Land rehabilitation programs: for restoring areas damaged by mineral excavation and extraction.

See also NATURAL RESOURCES - Water resources - Waterway management: for strategies for salinity management and river care programs.'@en

dct:description:
'Investigating practical applications for geographical data. Providing advice on the development of standards, protocols and specifications for spatial information systems. Includes developing integrated access to information via the Internet, mobile information systems and global positioning systems (GPS).

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE: for planning of facilities to support GPS.

See also COMMUNICATIONS: for broadcasting and data transfer standards.

See also DEFENCE - Defence strategic support - Defence science and technology: for applying scientific knowledge to military activities.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Navigation - Navigation systems development: for applying scientific knowledge to the plotting of courses at sea.

See also MARITIME SERVICES - Search and rescue - Search technology development: for applying scientific knowledge to marine rescue operations.'@en

dct:description: 'Administering learning and community support programs for primary and secondary students in target groups. Providing remedial education to assist those in difficulty, and extension programs for the gifted. Includes children with physical or intellectual disabilities, those with English as a second language, migrant or Indigenous children.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Special needs programs'@en
skos:definition: 'Administering learning and community support programs for primary and secondary students in target groups. Providing remedial education to assist those in difficulty, and extension programs for the gifted. Includes children with physical or intellectual disabilities, those with English as a second language, migrant or Indigenous children.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy to support the physical and mental wellbeing of people with particular requirements. Establishing health care programs to assist target groups. Includes advisory and support services for individuals with a particular medical condition.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Community support - Aged care services: for social support for elderly people.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Counselling services: for the provision of group therapy or psychological advice.

See also HEALTH CARE - Veterans\' health services: for programs to assist returned services personnel.

See also INDIGENOUS AFFAIRS - Indigenous health services: for programs to assist Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander communities.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing unique approaches to achieve specific military objectives. Deploying small units of highly trained combat personnel, in response to extraordinary circumstances or where specialist skills and equipment are required. Includes training provided to foreign local forces, when military aid is given to other countries.

See also DEFENCE - Emergency management - Disaster support: for emergency defence force assistance to other countries.

See also DEFENCE - Military law: for determining the legality of unconventional warfare.

See also SECURITY - Intelligence - Intelligence support: for gathering military intelligence in support of special operations.

See also SECURITY - External security - Peacekeeping forces: for units deployed to stabilise unrest and restore order.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Special operations'@en
skos:definition:
'Developing unique approaches to achieve specific military objectives. Deploying small units of highly trained combat personnel, in response to extraordinary circumstances or where specialist skills and equipment are required. Includes training provided to foreign local forces, when military aid is given to other countries.

See also DEFENCE - Emergency management - Disaster support: for emergency defence force assistance to other countries.

See also DEFENCE - Military law: for determining the legality of unconventional warfare.

See also SECURITY - Intelligence - Intelligence support: for gathering military intelligence in support of special operations.

See also SECURITY - External security - Peacekeeping forces: for units deployed to stabilise unrest and restore order.'@en

dct:description: 'Administering the allocation and use of radio spectrum or \'space\'. Assessing compliance with government regulations. Processing licence applications for bandwidth and radiofrequency. Monitoring signals allocation to reduce interference and developing long-term spectrum plans with defence, scientific, aircraft and maritime industries.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Spectrum management'@en
skos:definition: 'Administering the allocation and use of radio spectrum or \'space\'. Assessing compliance with government regulations. Processing licence applications for bandwidth and radiofrequency. Monitoring signals allocation to reduce interference and developing long-term spectrum plans with defence, scientific, aircraft and maritime industries.'@en

dct:description:
'Developing policy and programs to support the growth of competitive sports and associated industries. Encouraging increased participation and funding for sports and fitness programs. Providing training institutions and facilities for elite athletes.

See also BUSINESS SUPPORT AND REGULATION - Business association: for processes to incorporate a sporting body.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Community recreational programs - Public fitness promotion: for schemes to encourage physical activity.'@en

'Developing policy and programs to support the growth of competitive sports and associated industries. Encouraging increased participation and funding for sports and fitness programs. Providing training institutions and facilities for elite athletes.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Community recreational programs - Public fitness promotion: for schemes to encourage physical activity.'@en

dct:description: 'Developing policy and programs to encourage community participation in organised games or leisure activities. Implementing promotional strategies, providing funding and administering regulatory bodies.'@en
rdfs:label: 'SPORT AND RECREATION'@en
skos:definition: 'Developing policy and programs to encourage community participation in organised games or leisure activities. Implementing promotional strategies, providing funding and administering regulatory bodies.'@en

dct:description:
'Overseeing the care and preparation of land set aside for sporting grounds and amenities. Ensuring facilities are kept clean and maintained. Includes field or court markings, turf or pitch quality, spectator seating, and swimming pools.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Public land management - Recreational park management: for administration of public leisure areas and playgrounds.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Park and reserve services: for administration of sporting grounds.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Sport and fitness development - Sporting grants administration: for funding to build and develop sporting facilities.'@en

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Park and reserve services: for administration of sporting grounds.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Sport and fitness development - Sporting grants administration: for funding to build and develop sporting facilities.'@en

dct:description:
'Providing financial assistance to help build and develop sporting facilities. Identifying groups that may have less access to opportunities in sport. Allocating funds to support the training and development of athletes, coaches, officials and sports administrators.

See also CIVIC INFRASTRUCTURE - Public land management - Sporting facilities management: for administration of sporting facilities.

See also SPORT AND RECREATION - Sport and fitness development - Athlete scholarship programs: for financial assistance to highly skilled athletes.

dct:description:
'Determining a course of action in relation to the deployment of Australia\'s defence capability. Reaching a conclusion to direct the conduct of military operations. Resolving a dilemma or choosing from a range of options, to realise defence strategic policy.

See also DEFENCE - Military operations: for implementing strategic decisions in the conduct of campaigns.

See also INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS - Defence liaison - Military advisors: for guidance to support strategic decisions.'@en

See also INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS - Defence liaison - Military advisors: for guidance to support strategic decisions.'@en

dct:description:

See also ENVIRONMENT: for programs to conserve or protect wetlands and waterway ecosystems.'@en

skos:definition:
'Administering programs that support workplace diversity in accordance with human resources policy. Ensuring all people have equal access to employment opportunities and conditions, regardless of gender, race, colour, ethnicity, age, marital or parental status, sexual preference, disability or religious belief. Mediating disputes and managing resolution processes. Discouraging offensive behaviour, intimidation or harassment through training and information programs.

See also COMMUNITY SERVICES - Social justice and equity: for ensuring equal access to community services.

See also DEFENCE - Defence force careers - Military employment services: for workplace programs in the defence forces.

See also EMPLOYMENT - Human resources development - Workplace discrimination monitoring: for evaluating the effectiveness of equity and justice programs.

See also EMPLOYMENT - Workplace agreement processes - Agreement dispute mediation: for resolving queries about the application of workplace agreements.'@en

dct:description:
'Administering programs of training that provide learning and development opportunities for personnel already employed in an organisation. Includes courses to improve computer literacy, learn job-specific skills, personal or career development programs and training to maintain or upgrade professional qualifications.

See also EDUCATION AND TRAINING - Military education and training: for workplace training offered to defence personnel.

See also EMPLOYMENT - Human resources development: for career development advice.'@en
rdfs:label: 'Workplace training'@en
skos:altLabel: 'Trade union training'@en|'Personal development training'@en|'Career development training'@en|'Professional development training'@en

dct:description: 'Developing policy to support the maintenance of items or areas registered by UNESCO in accordance with the World Heritage Convention for protection and conservation. Assessing natural, Indigenous and historic sites in Australia for possible inclusion on international heritage lists. Includes liaison with international bodies and community groups to manage the listing process.'@en
